 Hi,
I have tried your extension and it works really good for me. I have two
qestions.
* How do I get it to work with the swingui?
* My test classes doesn't extend Testcase. They extend 'ourtestclass' which
extends testcase. How can I get it to work with that setup?

Thank you

-----Original Message-----
From: Di Iorio, Matthew (ISS Atlanta)
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Sent: 2001-04-20 23:59
Subject: [junit] TestFinderSuite for JUnit

Imagine never having to maintain an AllTests class again!  Wouldn't it
be
great if JUnit would pick-up test classes the same way it picks up
tests?
If this sounds good, read on...

I've taken Andy Schneider's TestAll code from his JavaWorld article
(http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit.html) and
reworked it a bit to fit into JUnit (in the extensions package).  For
those
of you not familiar with the TestAll code, it is a mechanism to
auto-discover tests so you don't have to remember to add your tests to a
TestSuite.

The TestFinderSuite will build a TestSuite by searching through the
classpath looking for TestCases.  You can even give it a package to
limit
the search.  The following example would run all the tests in the
'com.foo'
package:

import junit.extensions.TestFinderSuite;
public class AllTests {
  public static void main( String args[] ) {
    junit.textui.TestRunner.run( new TestFinderSuite( "com.foo" ) );
  }
}

OR to run tests in certain packages:

    TestSuite allMyTests = new TestSuite();
    allMyTests.addTest( new TestFinderSuite( "com.foo.common.tests" ) );
    allMyTests.addTest( new TestFinderSuite( "com.foo.application.tests"
)
);
    junit.textui.TestRunner.run( allMyTests );

To use it just put the attached jar file in your classpath when running
JUnit.  You will have to modify your current AllTests or create a new
one.

The TestFinderSuite tries to pickup only valid TestCases.  That said,
it's
not advisable to run it against the junit.test package, since there are
so
many mock TestCase's that get picked up.  I've found that it works for
most
other projects, though.

I'm curious to see if anyone finds this useful.  Feel free to mail me
with
questions, comments or bugs.
